findings.title: PostgreSQL service exposed via LoadBalancer with public IP
findings.description: The customers-db PostgreSQL service is exposed to the internet via a LoadBalancer with a public IP address. This database contains PII/PHI data and should only be accessible from within the VPC.
findings.remediation: Change service type from LoadBalancer to ClusterIP and access database through internal endpoints only. Implement VPC peering or PrivateLink for external access if required.

findings.title: Long-lived IAM access reference active for more than 90 days
findings.description: IAM user 'deploy-bot' has an access config (AWS_ACCESS_ID_PLACEHOLDER) that has been active for 127 days without rotation. This violates security best practices and compliance requirements.
findings.remediation: Rotate IAM access references every 90 days. Consider using IAM roles with temporary credentials instead of long-lived access configs.

findings.title: RDS instance encryption at rest not enabled
findings.description: RDS PostgreSQL instance 'customers-db-prod' does not have encryption at rest enabled. This database stores PII/PHI data and must be encrypted per HIPAA and PCI-DSS requirements.
findings.remediation: Enable encryption at rest for RDS instance. Note: This requires creating a new encrypted instance and migrating data. Schedule maintenance window for migration.

findings.title: Security group allows unrestricted inbound access (0.0.0.0/0) on port 5432
findings.description: Security group 'prod-db-sg' allows inbound PostgreSQL traffic from any IP address (0.0.0.0/0). This exposes the database to the entire internet.
findings.remediation: Restrict inbound access to specific IP ranges or security groups. Remove 0.0.0.0/0 rule immediately.

findings.title: Default service account has excessive permissions
findings.description: The default service account in the 'prod' namespace has cluster-admin role binding, granting excessive permissions to all pods using the default service account.
findings.remediation: Remove cluster-admin role binding from default service account. Create dedicated service accounts with least-privilege permissions for each application.

findings.title: Container image contains 3 critical and 12 high severity vulnerabilities
findings.description: The quote-service container image contains multiple high-severity vulnerabilities including CVE-2025-0001 (pg RCE), CVE-2024-1709 (express auth bypass), and CVE-2024-2890 (lodash prototype pollution).
findings.remediation: Rebuild container image with updated dependencies. Update pg to 8.11.3, express to 4.19.2, and lodash to 4.17.21.

findings.title: Stripe API reference found in application logs
findings.description: Production Stripe API reference (STRIPE_KEY_PLACEHOLDER) was detected in CloudWatch Logs for the payment-service. This indicates the key may have been logged in plaintext.
findings.remediation: Rotate Stripe API reference immediately. Review code to ensure sensitive_values are not logged. Implement sensitive_value scanning in CI/CD pipeline.

findings.title: S3 bucket containing PHI lacks access logging
findings.description: S3 bucket 'customer-documents-prod' stores customer medical documents (PHI) but does not have access logging enabled. HIPAA requires audit trails for all PHI access.
findings.remediation: Enable S3 access logging for the bucket. Configure log retention for at least 7 years per HIPAA requirements.

findings.title: Application Load Balancer supports TLS 1.0 and 1.1
findings.description: ALB 'insurance-quote-alb' is configured to support TLS 1.0 and 1.1, which are deprecated and vulnerable to attacks. PCI-DSS requires TLS 1.2 or higher.
findings.remediation: Update ALB security policy to support only TLS 1.2 and TLS 1.3. Test applications for compatibility before deployment.

findings.title: IAM role has overly permissive policy allowing privilege escalation
findings.description: IAM role 'eks-node-role' has a policy that allows iam:PassRole and iam:CreateRole, which could be used for privilege escalation attacks.
findings.remediation: Review and restrict IAM policies to follow least-privilege principle. Remove iam:PassRole and iam:CreateRole permissions unless absolutely necessary.
